Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Tasty \Tast"y\ (t[=a]st"[y^]), a. [Compar. {Tastier} (t[=a]st"[i^]*[etl]r); superl. {Tastiest}.] 1. Having a good taste; -- applied to persons; as, a tasty woman. See {Taste}, n., 5. [1913 Webster]
2. Being in conformity to the principles of good taste; elegant; as, tasty furniture; a tasty dress. [1913 Webster]

tasty adj 1: especially pleasing to the taste; "a dainty dish to set before a kind"; "a tasty morsel" [syn: {dainty}] 2: pleasing to the sense of taste [syn: {mouth-watering}, {savory}, {savoury}] [also: {tastiest}, {tastier}]
